item.title: Report E-2024100258
item.description:
Report E-2024100258

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-10T09:22:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-18
  • City: SALINA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0824ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release located at terminal XAE. It was reported that approximately 8 ounces of Linc Clean 2760M released from (1) 275-gallon poly tote due to punctures on top corners of the tote that had tape covering it. The release impacted the trailer floor and other freight. The contractors transferred the product to a new 275-poly tote, cut up and containerized the damaged tote, cleaned and neutralized the impacted area with vinegar. All impacted waste material was placed into a poly lined flex ben along with cut-up tote and staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024100209
item.description:
Report E-2024100209

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-10T09:22:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-11
  • City: WICHITA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO/XWK called in to report a 1-quart spill of UN1219 "Isopropanol" from an unknown number of 500 mL glass vials caused by improper loading and impacting their trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller who confirmed they were comfortable cleaning the spill with PPE per the SDS. Terminal personnel containerized (2) 5-gallon metal drums with (2) boxes of 12-500 mL glass vials of Isopropanol and Oil Dri.

item.title: Report X-2024100353
item.description:
Report X-2024100353

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-05T09:31:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-24
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS RESPONDED TO BY DESIGNATED RESPONDER AFTER A CALL WAS RECEIVED FROM THE PD1 OUTBOUND SUPERVISOR. PACKAGE WAS BEING PREPARED FOR LOADING WHEN INTERIOR CONTENTS OF THE PACKAGE (AIR BAG), DEPLOYED INSIDE BOX. A CORNER OF THE PACKAGE CAUGHT FIRE AND WAS IMMEDIATELY PUT OUT BY THE AREA SUPERVISOR, ALL EVENTS OCCURING BEFORE DESIGNATED RESPONDERS HAD BEEN ALERTED. PACKAGE WAS RETRIEVED AND BROUGHT BACK TO DMP. H S SUPERVISOR, BASE SUPERVISOR, AND SORT MANAGER WERE ALERTED TO THE EVENT. PACKAGE WAS INSPECTED TO FIND THE STEERING COLUMN WITH AIR BAG DEPLOYED, NO INTERIOR PACKAGING, NO EXTERNAL HAZARDOUS MARKINGS, AND WAS PREPARED IN A REUSED FIBERBOARD BOX.
